metadata.title: ECP establishes Monitoring Centre for PP-52 by-elections

content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, May 30 (APP): The Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) has set up Election Monitoring and Control Centre (EMCC) to ensure transparency and address public complaints during the upcoming PP-52 , Sialkot, provincial assembly by-elections on June 1. The center, set up at ECP headquarters, is tasked with monitoring the electoral process, offering voters a dedicated platform to voice concerns and ensuring prompt resolution of grievances. Complaints can be submitted at EMCCs through email at complaints@ecp.gov.pk, emphasizing the availability of a round-the-clock helpline at 051-111-327-000 for their convenience. Moreover, complaints can be lodged via fax at 051-9204404.
